newsitem.title: USA: Great Western holders back three consents.
newsitem.headline: Great Western holders back three consents.

text.p: Great Western Financial Corp said Monday a preliminary tablation showed 53 percent of the oustanding Great Western shares backed three consent solicitations of H.F. Ahmanson and Co.
Great Western said the three proposals are by-law amendments concerning the timing of the annual meeting, adjournment of the annual meeting and further amendment of by-law amendments.
Great Western said the count of unrevoked consents is preliminary in nature and the validity of consents is subject to review and challenge by both Great Western and Ahmanson.
Great Western said independent inspectors have not reported any preliminary count on two other proposals for which Ahmanson has been soliciting consents.
Great Western said in its news release that the solicitation covered only "very specific resolutions and by-law amendments."

"It was not a vote on the relative merits of the Great Western/Washington Mutual Inc merger and Ahmanson's unsolicited proposal," Great Western said. "Nor is it an indication of whether Great Western stockholders would or would not support the election of three Ahmanson designees to Great Western's board at the 1997 annual meeting. Any attempt to characterize the consent solicitation otherwise would be misleading and wrong."
After Ahmanson launched a bid for Great Western in February, Great Western signed a defnitive merger agreement with Washington Mutual.
